Please update OP Community on Layer2dao use of grants funds and Layer2dao hack.
Would be great to use a few minutes to discuss how committees would like to allocate the $40k retroactive component of their compensation for S2

[GF: Phase 0 Proposal] Layer2DAO Governance Fund: Phase 0       Thank you to the delegates who have been monitoring active grants, we appreciate you flagging unusual transactions related to L2DAO’s grant. The Foundation has spoken with the L2DAO team and they have shared a spreadsheet where they are tracking the OP tokens they are re-accumulating.  Grant recipients are expected to distribute their grants with complete transparency. If there are any distributions or transactions that deviate from what has been specified in a grant proposal, it should be discl…

Topics I would love to see added:     [Temp-Check] - Give Incentives to Solve Voters Apathy 🏛 Governance       Example made things clear, I did misunderstood your last comment. But even in this example, total number of token delegated remains same at 1K even after shuffling which could lead us to same situation we are now, users might use to token for different usage and overall delegated token will slowly come down to 900, 800 and so on…As seen in the chart above, we drop down from 35M to 22M.   To me, voter apathy means lack of interest from their side. Either they believe that their vote could not mak…     What is the community thinking about delegator/delegate incentives? How can we avoid wasting the time of big and known brains? I don’t like seeing them harassed and spammed Can Optimism Foundation name someone who we as delegates can lean on when we have governance issues?
One more: Do you think committes worked? should they go another cycle?
Agenda/slides can be found here.
I would appreciate if we did this on Discord next time, it’s a lot easier to get all the top delegates present for these calls that way
Will there be recording of this made available?
Hey! Just posted the recording here Recap: Community Call #8 (November 8th)

I would like to discuss this for sure     Competitions are Better 🏛 Governance       Last season as a community we had a realization that the grants we’ve been distributing from the community governance fund have had somewhat disappointing results in terms of user stickiness and TVL.  The goal of this thread is to examine why this is and how we can improve on this for next season. Specifically, thinking about competitions as a better use of grant funds.  Background: Starting from first principles, why are we even spending this $OP on grants on the first place? The whole point of…

content.content: @haonan I’m wondering if you included PoolTogether in your analysis? I’m guessing maybe not because the first grant came from the Foundation. Regardless, you may want to look at it as a case study as I think the OP incentives were a lot more effective than the ones you are looking at here. Driving $35+ million plus in deposits from currently 19,000+ unique depositors. I outlined the results in some detail here: PoolTogether Grant Update  Screen Shot 2022-10-26 at 10.44.47 AM1920×1222 81 KB
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: velodrome and aave weren’t in there either and I expect massively outpaced the average. in the video aave is discussed and early reports suggest (tho aren’t definitive) that aave did extraordinarily well. what I’d love to see, given their data accumulation, is a distribution of results. @haonan is there a way to access raw data used for the insights, or were the cases etc eyeballed from separate dune queries?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: RECAP of the call (also recorded).   Governance Fund Dissection. There was a sobering and yet very clarifying presentation by @haonan and @MSilb7 analyzing some key data. It’s worth watching repeatedly. Here are some phrases that stood out:   “Overall performance is mixed” “Some of the results may be unpleasant to look at” “Distribution has been slow” “Broadly ineffective” “We can do much much better”  Takeaways to consider during the upcoming Reflection Period: Make the gov fund more nimble, accountable, and clearly scoped.   Snapshot voting issues persist for some delegates. The Foundation is doing an analysis to figure out a “durable solution for the long run.”   OP from grants cannot be sold to fund development or R&D. This violates the “no sale” guidance from the Foundation.   Delegates voting against Governance Committee recommendations: The original intention was to establish a kind of social contract between committees and delegates such that delegates would be comfortable deferring decision-making to the committees. If delegates (whether or not on a Governance Committee) dissent from a committee recommendation, they are expected to provide an explanation. If a dissenting delegate is on a Governance Committee, that explanation is expected to be more robust than otherwise.   “Nothing is perfect right now,” but there are “many iterations” ahead of us and “we really need to make sure we are treating each other with respect and empathy through the process,” @bobby said in an eloquent moment of encouragement at the end of the call.   @Michael will be hosting the next call on November 8. Anyone can sign up to host – use this form.

content.content: hi @Leighton! the analysis presented only included grants made from the governance fund, since delegates are only making grant decisions coming out of that fund. All Partner Fund grants were excluded, and these grants have been relatively more effective.

Are you thinking of incinerating the OP with gas?   Are you thinking of running another channel for the community?   Can you provide text in various languages ​​for overseas users?   How will airdrop 2 proceed and will airdrops continue afterward?
Thanks for volunteering to host the call @jrocki.eth!

hait:   Are you thinking of running another channel for the community? Can you provide text in various languages ​​for overseas users?    Thanks for posting!   Can you elaborate on what you mean by running another channel for the community? We have the gov-general channel in the Optimism Discord.   That is a good suggestion.

Telegram is widely used among Korean investors.  It is divided into two types: a public room where you can get information quickly and a communication room where you can quickly communicate with each other.  And for new inflows, we hope to operate official channels such as TikTok, YouTube, and Facebook.  Also, I hope you preoccupy new means of promotion (eg, phaver, lens protocol, etc.) that are rapidly entering wep3.

Sounds good! Will add to the agenda.

Hey there, @blairdrop.eth I felt I found the answers you looking for in this presentation by smartcontracts.eth, he goes through some of the most important milestones to complete on the path to decentralization. The audio is low but it’s a very informative presentation.      Hope that helps @Michael Thanks for setting up the call
Thank you @Butterbum and @Michael

Hey Everyone. We have the Community Governance Call happening in about 1 hour! I just wanted to ping DeFi Committees A and C one more time because we’ve slotted some time on this call for deciding how to split up DeFi proposals. @GFXlabs @linda @Bobbay_StableLab @fig @OPUser @Gonna.eth @SEED_LATAM_Joxes @MinimalGravitas @ScaleWeb3 @katie. Again, we also have room for open discussion so if you’d like to talk about something governance, this call is a good place for that. See you there! Zoom link is here: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/88063153058?pwd=aGRoM3dxTERlUndZS0diamxNUlJNdz09
Thank you @Michael . I wont be able join but if other committee member wont make it to the call too, we will take it offline with Katie and share the outcome.

discourse_list.title: 5th OP Community Governance Call [September 27th @ 10am PT / 1pm ET / 7pm CET]

content.content: Hi Everyone, We have our fourth community governance call scheduled for next Tuesday, September 27th at 10am PT / 1pm ET / 7pm CET. The call is open to anyone in the OP Community to join. If you would like any topics added to the agenda, reply below and I will make sure to include them! Current Agenda: 2022/9/27 Optimism Bi Weekly Governance Call - Google Slides Meeting Details: Google Calendar Link Zoom Link  Meeting ID: 816 9847 8479 Passcode: 263407

I wont be joining the call but see if you could squeeze few question from my side.   During the cycle, I wanted to contribute to proposal outside of my committee(DeFI & NFT ) but I was hesitant as this might seem like I am front running the dedicated committee ? This is my personal, what does the committee think about this ?   When giving delegate approval, shouldn’t we also write our reasoning ? A single line statement, what did you like in the proposal?   New dedicated website (Discord link) should be mention on top of gov funding template so that the team submitting the proposal is aware of complete process. May be someone can improve this flowchart, they say a picture is worth a thousand words.
Great job with the slide deck @Michael. very clean and well organized
Thank you! Also - bumping this post for visibility.
